Kadalīgāma：A village to the north of Samantakūta and on the road which led to it from the north．It is situated on a small river which joins the Maskeli river and ultimately flows into the Kelani river．Vijayabāhu I，built rest-houses at the village for the use of pilgrims coming to Samantakūta （Cv．lx．66）．



Kadalī is to be identified with the modern Kehelgamuva （Cv．Trs．i．221，n．3）．



Perhaps the Kadalisenagāma，where Devappatirāja built a bridge of one hundred staves，may be the same village，but this is questionable （Cv．lxxxvi．41）．This is more likely to be the modern Kehellenāva （Cv．Trs．ii．174，n．3）．
